definition: Qin Hui (1090-1155 AD), Song Dynasty official said to have betrayed General Yue Fei 岳飛|岳飞[Yue4 Fei1]
surname Qin/Qin dynasty (221-207 BC) of the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]/abbr. for 陝西|陕西[Shan3 xi1]

sentences.english: Qin Hui family was free, Zhao Gou is still doing his emperor.
sentences.chinese: 秦檜一家都被免官，趙構仍在做他的皇帝。

sentences.english: The history of Qin Hui is dead.
Qin Hui critically ill, the emperor personally to visit.
sentences.chinese: 秦檜病危後，高宗曾親自前往探望。

sentences.english: Qin Hui put all the blame attributed to the "big traitor."
sentences.chinese: 把一切罪過歸咎於秦檜這個“大奸臣”。

sentences.english: Qinhui played lots of infamous plots.
sentences.chinese: 秦檜耍過很多臭名昭著的陰謀。

definition: to banish (to an army post, as a punishment)
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
Zhao Gao (?-207 BC), one of the most vile, corrupt and powerful eunuchs in Chinese history, responsible for the fall of Qin Dynasty
Nurhaci (1559-1626), founder and first Khan of the Manchu Later Jin dynasty 後金|后金 (from 1616)
to involve others (in a crime)/guilt by association
Zhu Qizhen, personal name of sixth and eighth Ming emperor Zhengtong 正統|正统[Zheng4 tong3], afterwards Tianshun Emperor 天順|天顺[Tian1 shun4] (1427-1464), reigned 1435-1449 and 1457-1464
to be devoid of all humanity/inhuman/bestial
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
